story.text: QUITO Jan 3 Ecuador's incoming government is considering forcing bond holders to accept a buy back of the country's global bonds due in 2012 by threatening not to pay interest, designated Economy Minister Ricardo Patino said on Wednesday. Patino, who was named by President-elect Rafael Correa as his economy minister, was asked if he had considered announcing that the government would not pay interest to force creditors to accept a buy back to be managed through a Dutch auction. "This is an alternative and we are studying several alternatives," answered Patino in a television program, without giving more details. A Dutch auction starts with a asking price that moves downward until it is accepted by a bidder. Correa, who will be sworn in as president later this month, has caused jitters on Wall street with threats to interrupt bond payments as he seeks to lower the Andean country's debt burden.
story.title: ecuador mulls bond buyback , suspension of payments
